credit_line: Gift of John Goldsmith Phillips, Jr.
title: The Picnic Excursion from Appleton's Journal, August 14, 1869, p. 624
medium:
Wood engraving on off-white wove paper
Support: paper
description:
Horizontal view of two groups of men and women setting out in two three-seated White Mountain wagons.  In the right foreground, a kneeling gentleman holds a bottle of wine and a basket while two ladies stand by.  This gentleman is believed to be a self portrait by Homer.  A dog rests in the grass on the left.  

[Above information taken from: David Tatham, Winslow Homer and the Pictorial Press (Syracuse: Syracuse University Press, 2003), p. 44.
name: Print
